page.title: 05Farming in Halstead
page.content: On Friday the 14th June a local farmer came to tell us about his farm for the Domesday Project. He started farming to keep his family farm going. They have been {farming in Halstead for 200 years.}He has{160 acres}and{he grows wheat, {barley, oats, cabbages, brussel {sprouts, courgettes, and potatoes.}The animals on his farm are{sheep,}a few {chickens, ducks and geese.}He shears the sheep himself once a year and they are dipped twice a year. The fleece goes to a woollen mill in Ashford. He sells very few sheep for meat because he is trying to build up his flock. His wheat goes to Germany, Belgium, Holland and Poland via a local mill and his vegetables to Covent Garden. {There are three other similar farms in {Halstead}and two others keeping pigs and chickens.
